Feat.Name: Human Ambition
Feat.Description: At level 1 humans get 1 bonus feat due to their ambition.

Feat.Name: Human Learning
Feat.Description: At level 1 humans get 15 bonus skill points.

Feat.Name: Human Ambitious
Feat.Description: Humans are ambitious and gain experience 2% faster than other races.

Feat.Name: Arcanist
Feat.Description: Humans that seek to master magic often turn to the arcanist specialization. It grants them unique abilities.

Feat.Name: Scientist
Feat.Description: Humans that reject magic and the supernatural often turn to the old ways of science and chemistry.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Resistances
Feat.Description: Dwarves are resistant to poison and energy damage.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Toughness
Feat.Description: Dwarves are tougher and get a +2 bonus to their Fortitude saves.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Proficiencies
Feat.Description: Dwarves are good with most axes and hammers.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Skills
Feat.Description: Dwarves are skiled smiths and fighting with axes and blunt weapons like hammers.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Defender
Feat.Description: Dwarven warriors that are clan champions can specialize as defenders. It grants them unique abilities.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Runesmith
Feat.Description: Dwarven runesmiths are the worlds greatest enchanters and can craft the best weapons and armor.

Feat.Name: Elves Resistances
Feat.Description: Elves are resistant to sleep and mental attacks.

Feat.Name: Elves Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All elves can use short bows and swords.

Feat.Name: Elven Skills
Feat.Description: Elves are skilled with arcane magic, enchanting and fighting with bows.

Feat.Name: Elven High Mage
Feat.Description: Masters of magic, elven high mages have spent lifetimes perfecting their craft.

Feat.Name: Arcane Archer
Feat.Description: Mixing pinpoint accuracy with a bow and magic, arcane archers are often drawn from the ranks of dual-class rangers and fighters.

Feat.Name: Hobbit Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All hobbits can use throwing rocks and darts.

Feat.Name: Hobbit Skills
Feat.Description: Hobbits are skilled at throwing rocks and keeping hidden.

Feat.Name: Burgler
Feat.Description: Hobbits are small, dextrious and are good at being burglers. This specialization grants them unique abilities.

Feat.Name: Gnome Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All gnomes can use sticks and stones.

Feat.Name: Gnomes Skills
Feat.Description: Gnomes are skilled at illusion magic and are tinkerers with rare items and artifacts.

Feat.Name: Gnome Illusionist
Feat.Description: Gnomes have a natural affinity for illusion magic. Some knowns become masterse of the art, surpassing all others in creating illusions.

Feat.Name: Dark Elf Resistances
Feat.Description: Dark Elves are resistant to magical damage.

Feat.Name: Dark Elf Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All dark elves can use light crossbows and swords.

Feat.Name: Dark Elf Skills
Feat.Description: Dark Elves are quicker and good with crossbows. Their dark reputation makes them hard to like.

Feat.Name: Dark Elf Arachnomancer
Feat.Description: Living deep underground dark elves rely on spiders for transportation, as pets and as guards. Some dark elf mages are experts in spider-based magic.

Feat.Name: Orc Resistances
Feat.Description: Orc are resistant to poison and cold.

Feat.Name: Orc Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All orcs can wield hatchets, hand axes, battle axes, greataxes and light spears.

Feat.Name: Orc Skills
Feat.Description: Orcs are skiled with axes and can make large jumps.

Feat.Name: Orc Shaman
Feat.Description: The true leaders of orc society are their shamans, who dictate when and how orc chieftains may seek conquest.

Feat.Name: Minotaur Resistances
Feat.Description: The hairy hides of minotaurs make them resistant to slashing weapons and fire.

Feat.Name: Minotaur Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All minotaurs can use hand axes, battle axes, greataxes and glaives.

Feat.Name: Minotaurs Skills
Feat.Description: Minotaurs are skiled with axes and wielding weapons in both hands.

Feat.Name: Minotaur Gladiator
Feat.Description: The Games are the center of Minotaur culture and their gladiators are their most honoured warriors.

Feat.Name: Ogre Resistances
Feat.Description: The thick hides of ogres make them resistant to blunt weapons and fire.

Feat.Name: Ogre Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All ogres can use clubs and greatclubs.

Feat.Name: Ogre Skills
Feat.Description: Ogres are skiled with blunt weapons and axes.

Feat.Name: Ogre Raider
Feat.Description: Ogres are savage warriors who take pleasure in pillage and plunder. Some of them specialize in raider the villages and towns of others, taking all the please.

Feat.Name: Felion Resistances
Feat.Description: Felions are resistant to lightning.

Feat.Name: Felions Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All felions can use daggers and throwing knives.

Feat.Name: Felion Skills
Feat.Description: Felions are skilled with knives and daggers and can evade attacks.

Feat.Name: Felion Acrobat
Feat.Description: Skilled and graceful beyond measure, felions make perfect acrobats.

Feat.Name: Rattus Resistances
Feat.Description: Rattus are resistant to poison and disease.

Feat.Name: Rattus Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All rattus can use darts and light crossbows.

Feat.Name: Rattus Skills
Feat.Description: Rattus are skilled at picking pockets and keeping hidden.

Feat.Name: Rattus Plaguecarrier
Feat.Description: The most lethal Rattus killers are known as plaguecarriers, they are experts in poisoning and spreading disease.

Feat.Name: Werewolf Weaknesses and Regeneration
Feat.Description: Werewolves are weak against silver weapons but slowly regenerate wounds.

Feat.Name: Werewolf Skills
Feat.Description: Werewolves are skilled at fighting with their claws and leaping.

Feat.Name: Poisoned Claws
Feat.Description: Werewolve claws are poisoned so all their attacks add 1 point of poison damage.

Feat.Name: Werewolf Pack Leader
Feat.Description: There can only be one alpha dog! Each werewolf clan has one male leader, if another wants to become leader they must first challenge the existing pack leader.

Feat.Name: Draconian Resistances
Feat.Description: Draconians are resistant to acid and poison and weak against cold.

Feat.Name: Draconian Skills
Feat.Description: Draconians are skilled at earth magic. As creations of magic, they are knowledgable in mythology and lore.

Feat.Name: Draconian Acid Breath
Feat.Description: Special attack that does minor acid damage to a small group of enemies.

Feat.Name: Black Dragon Disciple
Feat.Description: Draconians who delve into their dragon ancestry gain special abilities and powers.

Feat.Name: Lizardman Resistances
Feat.Description: Lizardmen are resistant to poison and their thick skin makes them resistant to crushing weapons but they are weak against cold.

Feat.Name: Lizardman Proficiencies
Feat.Description: All lizardmen can use spears and light spears.

Feat.Name: Lizardman Skills
Feat.Description: Lizardmen are skilled with fighting with their claws and using polearms.

Feat.Name: Lizardman Hunter
Feat.Description: Lizardmen who are at home in their swamps and skilled in tracking become hunters, fearsome and formidable.

Feat.Name: Seraphim Resistances
Feat.Description: Seraphim are resistant to divine magic but weak against unholy magic.

Feat.Name: Seraphim Skills
Feat.Description: Seraphim are skilled with divine magic and using swords.

Feat.Name: Holy Damage
Feat.Description: Seraphim add 1 point of holy damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Cambion Resistances
Feat.Description: Cambions are resistant to unholy magic but weak against divine magic.

Feat.Name: Cambion Skills
Feat.Description: Cambions are skilled with unholy magic and using knives and daggers.

Feat.Name: Unholy Damage
Feat.Description: Cambions add 1 point of unholy damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Ignis Resistances
Feat.Description: Ignis are resistant to fire but weak against cold.

Feat.Name: Ignis Skills
Feat.Description: Ignis are skilled with fire magic and artifacts.

Feat.Name: Fire Damage
Feat.Description: Ignis add 1 point of fire damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Ignis Pyromaniac
Feat.Description: Ignis like fire. Some ignis really, really, REALLY like fire.

Feat.Name: Hydros Resistances
Feat.Description: Hydros are resistant to cold but weak against fire.

Feat.Name: Hydros Skills
Feat.Description: Hydros are skilled with water magic and alchemy.

Feat.Name: Ice Damage
Feat.Description: Hydros add 1 point of ice damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Hydros Tundra Shaman
Feat.Description: Living alone in the frozen wastes some hydros become one with their elemental nature.

Feat.Name: Granote Resistances
Feat.Description: Granote are resistant to acid and blunt but weak against lighting.

Feat.Name: Granote Skills
Feat.Description: Granote are skilled with earth magic and smithing.

Feat.Name: Acid Damage
Feat.Description: Granote add 1 point of acid damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Granote Deep Delver
Feat.Description: Living alone deep underground some granote become one with their elemental nature.

Feat.Name: Aetheri Resistances
Feat.Description: Aetheri are resistant to lightning but weak against acid.

Feat.Name: Aetheri Skills
Feat.Description: Aetheri are skilled with air magic and bartering.

Feat.Name: Lightning Damage
Feat.Description: Aetheri add 1 point of lightning damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Aetheri Cloud Dancer
Feat.Description: Up in the highest mountain peaks where the clouds touch the earth, some Aetheri are most at home.

Feat.Name: Lich Resistances
Feat.Description: Lich are resistant to slashing and piercing weapons, cold, unholy magic but weak against holy and fire damage. They are also immune to sleep effects.

Feat.Name: Lich Skills
Feat.Description: Lich are skilled with arcane magic and necromancy.

Feat.Name: Lich Soul Juggler
Feat.Description: Liches must have knowledge of how souls exist to trap their own and become liches. Some liches take that knowledge to the next level and become masters of playing with the souls of others.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Weaknesses and Resistances
Feat.Description: Wampyri are weak against silver weapons, holy magic and fire but resist cold.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Skills
Feat.Description: Wampyri are skilled at beguiling mortals through mental magic and diplomacy.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Regeneration
Feat.Description: Wampyri regenerate stamina points quicker than mortals do.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Bite
Feat.Description: Wampyri can bite humanoid targets once per.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Mist
Feat.Description: Wampyri can summon a mist once per day to protect them.

Feat.Name: Wampyri Lord
Feat.Description: The oldest Wampyri become Lords, renowned and feared for both their physical and mental powers.

Feat.Name: Warrior
Feat.Description: This feat means the character has at least one level in one of the warrior group of classes. It is required to access other feats.

Feat.Name: Rogue
Feat.Description: This feat means the character has at least one level in one of the rogue group of classes. It is required to access other feats.

Feat.Name: Spellcaster
Feat.Description: This feat means the character has at least one level in one of the spellcaster group of classes. It is required to access other feats.

Feat.Name: Combat Veteran
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack.

Feat.Name: Wiley Veteran
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill get an additonal +1 bonus to attack.

Feat.Name: Thruster
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add 1 point of piercing damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Elite Thruster
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add a further 1 point of piercing damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Slasher
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add 1 point of slashing damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Elite Slasher
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add a further 1 point of slashing damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Crusher
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add 1 point of blunt damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Elite Crusher
Feat.Description: Warriors with this skill add a further 1 point of blunt damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Lucky
Feat.Description: Roges with this feat get a +1 bonus to armor and a +1 bonus to their reflex saving throws.

Feat.Name: Extremely Lucky
Feat.Description: Roges with this feat get a further +1 bonus to armor and a +1 bonus to their reflex saving throws.

Feat.Name: Backstab
Feat.Description: Special attack that does increases accuracy and damage. Success depends upon sneak skill.

Feat.Name: Improved Backstab
Feat.Description: Special attack that does increases accuracy and damage. Success depends upon sneak skill.

Feat.Name: Greater Backstab
Feat.Description: Special attack that does increases accuracy and damage. Success depends upon sneak skill.

Feat.Name: Superior Backstab
Feat.Description: Special attack that does increases accuracy and damage. Success depends upon sneak skill.

Feat.Name: Master Backstab
Feat.Description: Special attack that does increases accuracy and damage. Success depends upon sneak skill.

Feat.Name: Resevoire
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters pool of MP.

Feat.Name: Improved Resevoire
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters pool of MP.

Feat.Name: Master Resevoire
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters pool of MP.

Feat.Name: Arcane Power
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters spells, reducing the saving throws enemy targets get and the damage done by the spell.

Feat.Name: Improved Arcane Power
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters spells, reducing the saving throws enemy targets get and the damage done by the spell.

Feat.Name: Arcane Mastery
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a characters spells, reducing the saving throws and resistance enemy targets get and the damage done by the spell.

Feat.Name: Fighter Bonus Feat
Feat.Description: At level 1 fighters get 1 bonus feat due to their focusing only on fighting.

Feat.Name: Defensive Stance
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add 2 to their armor class at a penalty of 1 to their attack.

Feat.Name: Greater Defensive Stance
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add a further 2 to their armor class at a penalty of 1 to their attack.

Feat.Name: Master Defensive Stance
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add a further 2 to their armor class at a penalty of 1 to their attack.

Feat.Name: Reckless
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their armor class.

Feat.Name: More Reckless
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add a further 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their armor class.

Feat.Name: Very Reckless
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add a further 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their armor class.

Feat.Name: Precision
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their physical damage.

Feat.Name: Greater Precision
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add an additional 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their physical damage.

Feat.Name: Master Precision
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill add add an additional 2 to their attack at a penalty of 1 to their physical damage.

Feat.Name: One Handed Fighting Trainee
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack if they wield a one handed weapon without a shield or secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: One Handed Fighting Veteran
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to armor class if they wield a one handed weapon without a shield or secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: One Handed Fighting Master
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to damage if they wield a one handed weapon without a shield or secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: Two Handed Fighting Trainee
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack if they wield a two handed weapon.

Feat.Name: Two Handed Fighting Veteran
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to damage if they wield a two handed weapon.

Feat.Name: Two Handed Fighting Master
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +1 bonus to attack if they wield a two handed weapon.

Feat.Name: Sword and Shield Trainee
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to armor class if they wield a one handed weapon with a shield.

Feat.Name: Sword and Shield Veteran
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +1 bonus to armor class if they wield a one handed weapon with a shield.

Feat.Name: Sword and Shield Master
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a chance to counterstrike if they wield a one handed weapon with a shield.

Feat.Name: Two Weapon Fighting Trainee
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack if they wield a one handed weapon with a secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: Two Weapon Fighting Veteran
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to armor class if they wield a one handed weapon with a secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: Two Weapon Fighting Master
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +1 bonus to attack if they wield a one handed weapon with a secondary weapon.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Swords
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using swords.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Swords
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using swords.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Swords
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using swords.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Swords
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using swords.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Swords
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using swords.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Axes
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Axes
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using axes.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Axes
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using axes.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Axes
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Axes
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Daggers
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using daggers and other small bladed weapons.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Daggers
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using daggers and other small bladed weapons.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Daggers
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using daggers and other small bladed weapons.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Daggers
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using daggers and other small bladed weapons.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Daggers
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using daggers and other small bladed weapons.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Polearms
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using polearms such as spears, staves and halberds.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Polearms
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using polearms such as spears, staves and halberds.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Polearms
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using polearms such as spears, staves and halberds.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Polearms
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using polearms such as spears, staves and halberds.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Polearms
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using polearms such as spears, staves and halberds.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Blunt
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using blunt weapons such as maces and hammers.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Blunt
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using blunt weapons such as maces and hammers.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Blunt
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using blunt weapons such as maces and hammers.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Blunt
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using blunt weapons such as maces and hammers.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Blunt
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using blunt weapons such as maces and hammers.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Bows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using bows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Bows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using bows.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Bows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using bows.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Bows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using bows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Bows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using bows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Crossbows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using crossbows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Crossbows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using crossbows.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Crossbows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using crossbows.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Crossbows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using crossbows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Crossbows
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using crossbows.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Thrown
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using thrown weapons such as knives and axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Thrown
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using thrown weapons such as knives and axes.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Thrown
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using thrown weapons such as knives and axes.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Thrown
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using thrown weapons such as knives and axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Thrown
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using thrown weapons such as knives and axes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Martial Arts
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using hand to hand combat.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Martial Arts
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using hand to hand combat.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Martial Arts
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using hand to hand combat.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Martial Arts
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using hand to hand combat.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Martial Arts
Feat.Description: Fighters with this skill get an extra attack when using hand to hand combat.

Feat.Name: Beserker Rage
Feat.Description: Beserker goes into a rage for five minutes, attacking more often and more powerfully at the expense of their protection and accuracy.

Feat.Name: Greater Beserker Rage
Feat.Description: Beserker goes into a devastating rage for ten minutes, attacking more often and more powerfully at the expense of their protection and accuracy.

Feat.Name: Empowering Beserker Rage
Feat.Description: Beserker goes into a devastating rage for ten minutes, attacking more often and more powerfully at the expense of their protection and accuracy.

Feat.Name: Battlerager
Feat.Description: Berserkers with this feat specialize as battleragers. Battleragers are tougher and can resist more damage than other berserkers.

Feat.Name: Battlerager Lesser Resistance
Feat.Description: Having this feat increases a battleragers resistance to physical damage by 15%.

Feat.Name: Battlerager Resistance
Feat.Description: Having this feat increases a battleragers resistance to physical damage by a further 15%.

Feat.Name: Battlerager Greater Toughness
Feat.Description: Having this feat increases a battleragers health points by 30 more points.

Feat.Name: Warlord
Feat.Description: Berserkers with this feat specialize as warlords. Warlords lead hordes of fearless berserkers into battle.

Feat.Name: Warlord Courage
Feat.Description: Warlords are renowned for their fearlessness.

Feat.Name: Warlord Shout
Feat.Description: Warlords can inspire their comrades to be more effective in battle for 20 minutes.

Feat.Name: Warlord Determination
Feat.Description: Warlords can inspire their comrades to be resist fear and last longer in combat for 20 minutes.

Feat.Name: Juggernaught
Feat.Description: Berserkers with this feat specialize as juggernaughts. Juggernaughts are unstoppable killing machines known for their bloody battle frenzies.

Feat.Name: Juggernaught Toughness
Feat.Description: Juggernaughts with this feat increase their vitality by 1.

Feat.Name: Cleave
Feat.Description: Juggernaughts with this feat have a 10% chance to make extra attacks in combat.

Feat.Name: Axe Master
Feat.Description: Juggernaughts with this feat do more damage when fighting with axes.

Feat.Name: Lay On Hands
Feat.Description: The paladin touches an ally and heals them 1 to 3 health points per level.

Feat.Name: Divine Grace
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat get holy bonuses to their saving throws.

Feat.Name: Divine Courage
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat are immune to fear effects.

Feat.Name: Divine Defiance
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat can withstand more punishment. They get 5 more health points.

Feat.Name: Divine Devotino
Feat.Description: The paladin improves the saving throws and stamina regeneration rate of nearby allies for ten minutes.

Feat.Name: Divine Might
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat add 1 point to their strength and 1 point to their attack bonus.

Feat.Name: Holy Smite
Feat.Description: Special paladin attack that does more damage.

Feat.Name: Battle Blessing
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat add 1 point to their initiative and 2 points to their attack bonus.

Feat.Name: Divine Conduit
Feat.Description: Paladins with this feat add 1 point of holy damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Hands of the Healer
Feat.Description: The paladin touches an ally and heals them 50 health points.

Feat.Name: Crusader
Feat.Description: Crusaders are paladins who specialize as holy warriors.

Feat.Name: Blademaster
Feat.Description: Crusaders with this feat permanently increase their swords skill by 10.

Feat.Name: Armsmaster
Feat.Description: Crusaders with this feat permanently increase their attack bonus by 1.

Feat.Name: Dragonslayer
Feat.Description: Paladins who specialize in hunting dragons get some advantages against them.

Feat.Name: Knowledge: Dragonslaying
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a dragonslayer to be more effective against dragons in combat.

Feat.Name: Dragonslayer Protection
Feat.Description: Dragonslayers gain protection against dragon attacks.

Feat.Name: Magebane
Feat.Description: Paladins who specialize in hunting mages and heretics get some advantages against them.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Dispel Magic
Feat.Description: Magebanes can remove magic effects from enemies.

Feat.Name: Magebane Spell Immunity
Feat.Description: Magebanes become immune to sleep and control effects.

Feat.Name: Unholy Terror
Feat.Description: Blackguard ability that makes themselves more effective in combat.

Feat.Name: Lifesteal Strike
Feat.Description: Blackguard ability that allows them to drain life from an enemy that hit in combat.

Feat.Name: Demoralize
Feat.Description: Blackguard ability that makes their enemies less effective in combat.

Feat.Name: Strength Siphon
Feat.Description: Blackguard ability that to drain strength from an enemy.

Feat.Name: Child of Darkness
Feat.Description: Blackguards often hang around horrors and become immune to fear.

Feat.Name: Diabolical Conduit
Feat.Description: Blackguards with this feat add 1 point of unholy damage to all their attacks.

Feat.Name: Unholy Champion
Feat.Description: Blackguards that devote themselves to a nefarious cause often become champions for those causes.

Feat.Name: Death Knight
Feat.Description: Lich blackguards can become death knights, mastering both combat and magic.

Feat.Name: Tracking
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to track animals and prey.

Feat.Name: Ranger: Two Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a ranger's ambidexterity skill.

Feat.Name: Ranger: Greater Two Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Having this feat improves a ranger's ambidexterity skill even further.

Feat.Name: Bane: Animals
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against animals in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Plants
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against mutant plants in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Beasts
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against beasts and beast races in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Humanoids
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against humanoid races in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Undead
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against undead in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Constructs
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against constructs in combat.

Feat.Name: Bane: Dragon
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be more effective against dragons in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Animals
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against animals in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Plants
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against mutant plants in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Beasts
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against beasts and beast races in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Humanoids
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against humanoid races in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Undead
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against undead in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Constructs
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against constructs in combat.

Feat.Name: Greater Bane: Dragon
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a ranger to be even more effective against dragons in combat.

Feat.Name: Mystic Armor
Feat.Description: All spellswords surround themselves with a mystic shield which provides some protection.

Feat.Name: Mystic Knight
Feat.Description: Spellswords with this feat become mystic knights, able to channel elemental energy into their weapons.

Feat.Name: Flaming Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two points of fire damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Ice Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two points of ice damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Lightning Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two points of lightning damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Greater Flaming Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two more points of fire damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Greater Ice Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two more points of ice damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Greater Lightning Blade
Feat.Description: The mystic knight with this feat adds two more points of lightning damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Battlemage
Feat.Description: Spellswords with this feat become battlemages, able to harness the power of the destruction school of magic.

Feat.Name: Nightblade
Feat.Description: Spellswords with this feat become nightblades, able to harness the power of the illusion school of magic.

Feat.Name: Combat Reflexes
Feat.Description: Swashbucklers with this feat focus on avoiding attacks. They add 2 to their armor class at a penalty of 1 to their attack.

Feat.Name: Improved Combat Reflexes
Feat.Description: Swashbucklers with this feat add an additional 2 to their armor class at an additional penalty of 1 to their attack.

Feat.Name: Duelist
Feat.Description: Swashbucklers with this feat become duelists, skilled swordsmen who can parry many attacks against them.

Feat.Name: Duelist Veteran
Feat.Description: Duelists with enough experience becomes veterans with improved combat ability.

Feat.Name: Master Duelist
Feat.Description: Duelists with enough experience masters in their swordplay.

Feat.Name: Furtive
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat get a small bonus to stealth and scouting.

Feat.Name: Hired Blade
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat get a bonus to attack.

Feat.Name: Killer: Humanoid
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat have lots of experience killing humanoids.

Feat.Name: Killer: Beast
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat have lots of experience killing beings from the beast races.

Feat.Name: Killer: Undead
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat have lots of experience killing undead.

Feat.Name: Bounty Hunter
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat specialize in hunting their prey through cities and the wilderness.

Feat.Name: Bounty Hunter Tracking
Feat.Description: Bounty hunters with this feat gain the tracking ability, which normally can only be gained by rangers.

Feat.Name: Bounty Hunter Knowledge
Feat.Description: Bounty hunters with this feat gain knowledge about cities, civilizations, the wilderness and the strengths and weaknesses of humanoids and monsters.

Feat.Name: Shadow Warrior
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat specialize in silent kills using a single blow.

Feat.Name: Shadow Warrior Silent Strike
Feat.Description: Shadow Warriors with this feat get better at stealth and striking from the shadows.

Feat.Name: Shadow Warrior Instant Kills
Feat.Description: Shadow Warriors with this feat get better at using their deathstrike skill.

Feat.Name: Fade
Feat.Description: Shadow warriors with this feat can become invisible in combat once a day for 5 minutes.

Feat.Name: Venom Master
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat specialize in the use of poisons.

Feat.Name: Venom Master Protection
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat gain resistance to poisons and piercing damage.

Feat.Name: Venom Master Poison Strike
Feat.Description: Assassins with this feat add 2 points of poison damage to all their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Novice Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a very small bonus to their thieving skills.

Feat.Name: Apprentice Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a minor bonus to their thieving skills.

Feat.Name: Adept Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a moderate bonus to their thieving skills.

Feat.Name: Expert Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a large bonus to their thieving skills.

Feat.Name: Master Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a very large bonus to their thieving skills.

Feat.Name: Nimble Fingers
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a bonus to their reflexes, and their trap disabling, pick pocketing and pick locking skills.

Feat.Name: Sneak Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a bonus to their stealth and scouting skills.

Feat.Name: Dextrous
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a bonus to their dexterity ability.

Feat.Name: Safe Cracker
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a bonus to their pick pocketing and pick locking skills.

Feat.Name: Shadow Thief
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a large bonus to their stealth skill.

Feat.Name: Trap Cracker
Feat.Description: Thieves with this feat get a large bonus to their disable trap skill.

Feat.Name: Jack of All Trades
Feat.Description: Adventurers with this feat have experience in many skills and abilities.

Feat.Name: Greengrocer
Feat.Description: Adventurers who spend most of their times as merchants are known as greengrocers, and are often mocked by the rest of the adventuring community.

Feat.Name: X Agent
Feat.Description: Adventurers who join X get access to their large network.

Feat.Name: X Knowledge
Feat.Description: X Agents get access to their networks of spies and scholars.

Feat.Name: X Eye
Feat.Description: X Agents get a bonus to their saving throws.

Feat.Name: X Heart
Feat.Description: X Agents get a bonus to their health points and stamina points.

Feat.Name: X Smile
Feat.Description: X Agents get a bonus to their armor class.

Feat.Name: X Boon
Feat.Description: X Agents get a bonus to their ability to resist spells.

Feat.Name: Archaeologist
Feat.Description: Adventurers who specialize in exploration become archaeologists, knowledgeable about ancient civilizations and cultures.

Feat.Name: Experienced Digger
Feat.Description: Archaeologists gain expertise in disabling traps and identifying ancient manuscripts, tools and artifacts.

Feat.Name: Risky Business
Feat.Description: Archaeologists gain expertise is bartering for supplies and dealing with angry natives.

Feat.Name: Treasure Hunter
Feat.Description: Archaeologists with this feat gain expertise in their core fields of study, ancient cultures and civilizations.

Feat.Name: Entertainer
Feat.Description: Bards with this feat add 5 points to their perform and diplomacy skills.

Feat.Name: Lingering Song
Feat.Description: Bards with this feat add 5 minutes to the length of each of their songs.

Feat.Name: Song of Fascination
Feat.Description: The bard sings and one enemy humanoid must make a willpower save or be dazed.

Feat.Name: Song of Striking
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all allies get a bonus to their ability to hit enemies.

Feat.Name: Song of Terror
Feat.Description: The bard sings and a group of enemy hunanoids must make a willpower save or be terrified.

Feat.Name: Song of Protection
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all allies get a bonus to their armor class.

Feat.Name: Song of Speed
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all allies get a bonus to their initiative.

Feat.Name: Song of Heroism
Feat.Description: The bard sings and one ally get a bonus to their armor, saving throws and health points.

Feat.Name: Curse Song
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all enemies get a penalty to their attack and damage.

Feat.Name: Inspire Courage
Feat.Description: The bard inspires his comrades in battle, granting them +1 to attack and damage for four hours.

Feat.Name: Inspire Competence
Feat.Description: The bard inspires his comrades in their use of everyday, non-combat skills for eight hours.

Feat.Name: Inspire Defence
Feat.Description: The bard inspires his comrades in battle, granting them +2 to armor class and saving throws for four hours.

Feat.Name: Inspire Regeneration
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all allies get a bonus to their health point regeneration rate for four hours.

Feat.Name: Inspire Toughness
Feat.Description: The bard sings and all allies get a bonus to health points, vitality and fortitude saving throws for four hours.

Feat.Name: Jester
Feat.Description: Some bards specialize in being professional 'fools' in the courts of kings and lords. Their knowledge of humour and psychology gives them the ability to persuade others and manipulate them.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Taunt
Feat.Description: The jester can taunt an opponent in combat, making them reckless and enraged for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Foolish Story
Feat.Description: The jester can tell a humorous story which makes others more susceptible to persuasion for a very short time.

Feat.Name: Fool
Feat.Description: Experienced Jesters are usually not taken seriously, giving them many advantages over others.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Greater Taunt
Feat.Description: The jester can taunt an opponent in combat, making them reckless and enraged for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: King of Fools
Feat.Description: The most experienced Jesters often become invisible to others, they are noticed but dismissed by all but the most observant.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Enrage
Feat.Description: The jester can taunt a group of opponents in combat, sending them into a foolish rage for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Poisoner
Feat.Description: Some bards choose a shadier path and become expert poisoners, using their station and stealth abilities to slip past enemies defences.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Apply Poison
Feat.Description: The poisoner can apply poison to their weapons twice per day, increasing the damage they do for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Practiced Poisoner
Feat.Description: The more experienced poisoner bards become, the more their resistance to poison increases.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Apply Strong Poison
Feat.Description: The poisoner can apply even stronger poison to their weapons twice per day, increasing the damage they do for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Expert Poisoner
Feat.Description: Those bards that have mastered the arts of poisoning always carry poisons they apply to their weapons, increasing their damage.

Feat.Name: Jester Ability: Apply Deadly Poison
Feat.Description: The poisoner can apply a deadly poison to their weapons twice per day, increasing the damage they do for a period of time.

Feat.Name: Lore Initiates
Feat.Description: Most bards have some knowledge of various lores, but some specialize in lore and obscure knowledge.

Feat.Name: Lore Master Ability: Identify
Feat.Description: The lore master can cast the identify spell which increases their artifacts skill twice per day. The effect lasts one hour.

Feat.Name: Lore Accolytes
Feat.Description: Bards that continue their quest for knowledge are known as Lore Accolytes and have increased bonuses to various lore skills.

Feat.Name: Lore Master Ability: Legend Lore
Feat.Description: The lore master can cast the Legend Lore spell which increases their artifacts and history skills once per day. The effect lasts one hour.

Feat.Name: Lore Master
Feat.Description: Lore Masters are experts at obscure knowledge and have large bonuses to various lore skills.

Feat.Name: Lore Master Ability: Arcane Knowledge
Feat.Description: The lore master can cast a spell-like ability to raise their spellcasting, alchemy and enchanting skills once per day. The effect lasts one hour.

Feat.Name: Arcane Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all mage spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Arcane Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all mage spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Arcane Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat casts all their mage spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Arcane Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their mage spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Elementalist
Feat.Description: A mage with this feat becomes an elementalist, able to harness the power of fire, ice and lightning in battle.

Feat.Name: Flame Guard
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains resistance to fire.

Feat.Name: Pyromaniac
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat adds fire damage to all their damaging spells.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Fireball
Feat.Description: Elementalists who specialize in fire attacks can cast fireball twice per day without expending magic points.

Feat.Name: Master of Flames
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains furhter resistance to fire and adds more fire damage to their spells.

Feat.Name: Frost Guard
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains resistance to ice.

Feat.Name: Icy Demeanor
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat adds ice damage to all their damaging spells.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Iceball
Feat.Description: Elementalists who specialize in frost attacks can cast iceball twice per day without expending magic points.

Feat.Name: Master of Frost
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains furhter resistance to ice and adds more frost damage to their spells.

Feat.Name: Shock Guard
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains resistance to lightning.

Feat.Name: Fury of Lightning
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat adds lightning damage to all their damaging spells.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Lightning Bolt
Feat.Description: Elementalists who specialize in shock attacks can cast lightning bolt twice per day without expending magic points.

Feat.Name: Master of Lightning
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat gains furhter resistance to ice and adds more frost damage to their spells.

Feat.Name: Elemental Adept
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat has mastered all three prime elements, improving their spellcasting from those three schools.

Feat.Name: Master of the Elements
Feat.Description: An elementalist with this feat has mastered they can with the prime elements. All their spells cause more damage.

Feat.Name: Sage
Feat.Description: A mage with this feat becomes a sage, a mage learned in history and lore.

Feat.Name: Artifacts Of The Ages
Feat.Description: A sage with this feat has studied the itemcraft of past civilizations and is both able to recognize their work and duplicate it.

Feat.Name: Elemental Lore
Feat.Description: A sage with this feat has studied the magical lore of fire, water, earth and air and used that to supplement their spellcasting skill.

Feat.Name: Arcane Scholar
Feat.Description: A sage with this feat has studied the magical lore of past civilzations and learned much of the nature of sorcery from it.

Feat.Name: Wizard
Feat.Description: A mage with this feat becomes acknowledged as a wizard, as they have increased their spellcasting ability.

Feat.Name: Archmage
Feat.Description: A mage with this feat becomes acknowledged as a wizard, as they have increased their spellcasting ability.

Feat.Name: Archwizard
Feat.Description: A mage with this feat becomes acknowledged as an archwizard, as they have mastered arcane spellcasting.

Feat.Name: Archmage Spellpower
Feat.Description: An archmage with this feat has much more powerful spells than most mages.

Feat.Name: Mastery of Elements
Feat.Description: An archmage with this feat is skilled with the four elements of fire, ice, lightning and earth.

Feat.Name: Arcane Fire
Feat.Description: Archmages can use arcane fire five times per day, causing magical damage to one enemy.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Wizard Shield
Feat.Description: Archmages can master the wizard shield spell and cast it twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Reflect Spells
Feat.Description: Archmages can master the reflect spells spell and cast it twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Force Shield
Feat.Description: Archmages can master the force shield spell and cast it twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Ironskin
Feat.Description: Archmages can master the ironskin spell and cast it twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Unbinding
Feat.Description: Archmages can master the unbinding spell and cast it twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Infernal Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all warlock spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Infernal Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all warlock spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Infernal Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat casts all their warlock spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Infernal Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their warlock spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Eldritch Spells
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a warlock to add magical damage to all their spells.

Feat.Name: Eldritch Power
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a warlock to add more magical damage to all their spells.

Feat.Name: Diabolist
Feat.Description: Having this feat sets a warlock on a path of becoming a Diabolist.

Feat.Name: Demonic Source
Feat.Description: The diabolist channels infernal power to get a bonus to their magic point regeneration rate for two minutes.

Feat.Name: Demonic Vitality
Feat.Description: The diabolist channels infernal power to get a bonus to their health points for five minutes.

Feat.Name: Demonic Toughness
Feat.Description: Having this feat gives a diabolist tougher skin, improving their armor class.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Summon Imp
Feat.Description: The diabolist can summon an imp in combat twice per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Summon Demon
Feat.Description: The diabolist can summon a demon in combat twice per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Summon Demon
Feat.Description: The diabolist can summon a greater demon in combat twice per day.

Feat.Name: Hellfire Initiate
Feat.Description: Having this feat sets a warlock on a path of becoming a Hellfire Master.

Feat.Name: Hellfire Infused Spells
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a warlock to add hellfire damage to all their spells.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Hellfire
Feat.Description: Hellfire Masters can cast hellfire twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Hellfire Power
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a warlock to add more hellfire damage to all their spells and improves their fire magic.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Hellfire Blast
Feat.Description: Hellfire Masters can cast hellfire blast twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Hellfire Master
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a warlock to add more hellfire damage to all their spells and improves their fire magic even more.

Feat.Name: Spell-like Ability: Hellfire Storm
Feat.Description: Hellfire Masters can cast hellfire storm twice per day as a spell like ability.

Feat.Name: Chronomancer
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a character to cast spells quicker in combat.

Feat.Name: The Quickening
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a chronomancer to improve their initiative and speed for 10 minutes three times per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Mass Slow
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a chronomancer to cast the mass slow spell two times per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Mass Haste
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a chronomancer to cast the mass haste spell two times per day.

Feat.Name: Master of Time and Space
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a chronomancer to cast spells much quicker in combat.

Feat.Name: Holy Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all priest spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Holy Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all priest spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Holy Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat costs all their priest spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Holy Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their priest spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Healer
Feat.Description: A character with this feat has begun the path of the healer.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Healing Touch
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a healer to cast the healing touch spell two times per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Healing Aura
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a healer to cast the healing aura spell two times per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Mass Regeneration
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a healer to cast the mass regeneration spell two times per day.

Feat.Name: Vitality Boost
Feat.Description: A healer eventually gains a boost to their vitality and lifeforce.

Feat.Name: Witch Hunter
Feat.Description: Some priests specialize in hunting down witches and warlocks.

Feat.Name: Witch Hunter Protection
Feat.Description: Witchhunters can gain protection against magic, unholy and hellfire effects.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Dispel Magic
Feat.Description: Witch Hunters can remove magic effects from enemies three times per day.

Feat.Name: Witch Hunter Holy Smite
Feat.Description: Witchhunters can add holy damage to their spells.

Feat.Name: Witch Hunter Holy Strike
Feat.Description: Witchhunters can add holy damage to their physical attacks.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Greater Dispel Magic
Feat.Description: Witch Hunters can remove all magic effects from enemies two times per day.

Feat.Name: Warpriest
Feat.Description: Some priests specialize in battle, joining warriors in the front ranks of wars and fights.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Battle Blessing
Feat.Description: Warpriests can improve their allies combat abilities two times per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Group Shield
Feat.Description: Warpriests can improve their allies defensive abilities once per day.

Feat.Name: Battlelord
Feat.Description: Warpriests can become formidable fighters.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Magic Screen
Feat.Description: Warpriests can improve their allies magic defence abilities once per day.

Feat.Name: Unholy Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all necromancer spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Unholy Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all necromancer spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Unholy Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat costs all their necromancer spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Unholy Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their necromancer spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Bonedancer
Feat.Description: Some necromancers specialize in creating and controlling corpreal boned undead creatures like skeletons and bone golems.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Control Undead
Feat.Description: Bonedancers can control undead three times per day.

Feat.Name: Bonedancer Power
Feat.Description: Bonedancers become more skilled in combat than other necromancers.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Dance of the Dead
Feat.Description: Bonedancers can improve their combat abilities once per day.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Summon Bone Golem
Feat.Description: Bonedancers can summon bone golems once per day.

Feat.Name: Bonedancer: Skin of Bone
Feat.Description: Bonedancers modify their own bodies to be more skeletal and boney. This offers them protection against physical harm.

Feat.Name: Negative Energy Accolyte
Feat.Description: Some necromancers specialize in attacking with negative energy blasts.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Negative Energy Ray
Feat.Description: Three times per day a negative energy accolyte can blast an opponent for a moderate amount of unholy damage.

Feat.Name: Negative Energy Protection
Feat.Description: Negative energy accolytes gain a fair amount of protection against unholy damage and a small amount of protection against magical energy.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Negative Energy Blast
Feat.Description: Two times per day a negative energy accolyte can blast an opponent for a large amount of unholy damage.

Feat.Name: Negative Energy Mastery
Feat.Description: Negative energy accolytes gain skill casting spells that cause unholy damage.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Greater Negative Energy Burst
Feat.Description: Two times per day a negative energy accolyte can hurl a burst of unholy magic at a group of enemies.

Feat.Name: Havester of Souls
Feat.Description: Some necromancers specialize in stealing and feeding off the souls of their victims and using scythes in combat.

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus: Scythes
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters with this skill get a +1 bonus to attack when using polearms such as scythes.

Feat.Name: Souls Binder
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters channel the souls of their victims into their weapons, releasing magical energy with every strike.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization: Scythes
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters with this skill get a +2 bonus to damage when using polearms such as scythes.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Soul Burst
Feat.Description: Two times per day a soul harvester can unleash stored souls in a blast of magical energy at a group of opponents.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Focus: Scythes
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to attack when using polearms such as scythes.

Feat.Name: Soul Crafter
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters are experts at using the souls of victims to fuel their artifact enchanting.

Feat.Name: Advanced Weapon Specialization: Scythes
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters with this skill get a further +2 bonus to damage when using polearms such as scythes.

Feat.Name: Weapon Master: Scythes
Feat.Description: Soul Harvesters with this skill get an extra attack when using polearms such as scythes.

Feat.Name: Woodwalker
Feat.Description: A druid is at home in the wilderness and gets bonuses to sneaking and running.

Feat.Name: Nature Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all druid spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Nature Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all druid spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Nature Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat costs all their druid spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Nature Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their druid spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Friend of Animals
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat has specialized in knowing and befriending animals.

Feat.Name: Animal Instinct
Feat.Description: An animal friend begins to take on some of the characteristics of the animals they spend time with, improving their physical abilities.

Feat.Name: Animal Fighting
Feat.Description: An animal friend harnesses the combat abilities of the animals they have trained, improving their own combat abilities.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Fury of the Beast
Feat.Description: Once per day an animal trainer can enter the frenzy common among boars and other wild animals.

Feat.Name: Beast Trainer
Feat.Description: An animal friend has become skilled at training wild beasts.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Control Animal
Feat.Description: Two times per day an animal trainer can attempt to charm a wild animal, turning them to their will.

Feat.Name: Beastmaster
Feat.Description: A beastmaster is a druid who has mastered the art of training wild animals.

Feat.Name: Shaman Accolyte
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat has learned some of the basics of spirit and tribal magic.

Feat.Name: Shaman Initiate
Feat.Description: A shaman accolyte with enough experience is known as an initiate.

Feat.Name: Shaman Initiate
Feat.Description: A shaman accolyte with enough experience is known as an initiate.

Feat.Name: Head Shaman
Feat.Description: A head shaman is often the head of their tribe or group.

Feat.Name: Struck By Lightning
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat has been struck by a bolt of lightning and survived.

Feat.Name: Channel Lightning
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat can channel the lightning their body has absorbed and imbue the spears and other weapons with it, causing shock damage with every strike.

Feat.Name: Storm Rider
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat spends a lot of time in storms, improving their dexterity and air magic ability from their experiences.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Call Windstorm
Feat.Description: Two times per day a druid with this ability create a windstorm.

Feat.Name: Spellshocker
Feat.Description: A druid with this feat imbues all their damaging spells with lightning, causing extra shock damage.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Call Lightning Storm
Feat.Description: Two times per day a druid with this ability calls a lightning storm.

Feat.Name: Stormlord
Feat.Description: A stormlord is a druid who has mastered the ability to channel the chaotic power of storms and lightning energy.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Call Hurricane
Feat.Description: Once per day a stormlord with this ability create a powerful hurricane.

Feat.Name: Mind Apprentice
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -2 to saving throws on all psionic spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Mind Journeyman
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies a penalty of -10% to damage resistance on all psionic spells they cast at enemies.

Feat.Name: Mind Expert
Feat.Description: A character with this feat costs all their psionic spells at 1 less MP.

Feat.Name: Mind Master
Feat.Description: A character with this feat applies 10% extra damage to all their psionic spells that deal direct damage.

Feat.Name: Mindbender
Feat.Description: A psionic that specializes in telepathy is known as a mindbender.

Feat.Name: Mental Fortress
Feat.Description: A mindbender builds their willpower to extreme levels.

Feat.Name: Mental Toughness
Feat.Description: A mindbender beomces imune to sleep and can go for long periods without rest.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Control Humanoid
Feat.Description: A master mindbender can control a humanoid once per day.

Feat.Name: Telepath
Feat.Description: A mindbender with enough experience is known as a telepath.

Feat.Name: Sharp Minded
Feat.Description: A mindbender eventually becomes immune to control and masters telepathy.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Control Other
Feat.Description: A master mindbender can control any being once per day.

Feat.Name: Illusionist
Feat.Description: A psionic that focuses on misdirection becomes known as an illusionist.

Feat.Name: Sleight of Hand
Feat.Description: An illusionst develops nimble fingers and the ability to misdirect others even without using magic.

Feat.Name: Crowd Favorite
Feat.Description: Illusionist are often able to charm entire crowds with their tricks.

Feat.Name: Master Illusionist
Feat.Description: The best illusionists are granted the title of master.

Feat.Name: Spoonbender
Feat.Description: Other psionics derisively call those who specialize in telekinesis spoonbenders.

Feat.Name: Telekinetic Shield
Feat.Description: Using shields of air, telekinetic adepts can protect themselves from harm.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Hurl Debris
Feat.Description: A psionicist can use their minds to hurl nearby objects at their opponents six times per day.

Feat.Name: Telekinetic Master
Feat.Description: A few rare individuals have masted the arts of telekinesis.

Feat.Name: Spell Like Ability: Psychokinetic Burst
Feat.Description: A master of telekineses can cause objects to burst, harming those nearby four times per day.

Feat.Description: You are fascinated by knowledge and learning at the cost of not noticing your surroundings as you should.

Feat.Name: Adventurous
Feat.Description: You are always willing to try new experiences, which is fun but sometimes opens you up to unnecessary risks.

Feat.Name: Aggressive
Feat.Description: You are quick to initiate combat, and you tend to start fights that did not need to happen.

Feat.Name: Ambitious
Feat.Description: You are driven which helps you accomplish things others cannot. The downside is you are willing to step on those who get in your way.

Feat.Name: Ammoral
Feat.Description: You consider yourself to be beyond good and evil, those are concepts that lesser beings care about. You know there is only power.

Feat.Name: Argumentative
Feat.Description: You love getting into a good argument and seek them out where others would shy away from them.

Feat.Name: Arrogant
Feat.Description: You know you are smarter than others. If they cannot recognize their betters, it is their loss.

Feat.Name: Assertive
Feat.Description: You are confident and direct in claiming your rights and putting forward your views.

Feat.Name: Brawler
Feat.Description: You love a good fight, especially an unarmed one.

Feat.Name: Bigoted
Feat.Description: You dislike certain other races, and have no problem telling anyone about your dislikes.

Feat.Name: Boorish
Feat.Description: You can be crude, unmannered and insensitive towards others.

Feat.Name: Bossy
Feat.Description: You tend of boss other people around. This often gets you want you want at the expense of having others not like you.

Feat.Name: Capable
Feat.Description: You are more skilled than the average person.

Feat.Name: Cautious
Feat.Description: You are cautious in combat, taking less risks at the expense of not acting as quick as others.

Feat.Name: Charitable
Feat.Description: You are generous to others in need.

Feat.Name: Charming
Feat.Description: You have an attractive and pleasing personality.

Feat.Name: Cheerful
Feat.Description: You have a positive, attractive personality. You rarely get down in the dumps.

Feat.Name: Conceited
Feat.Description: You are vain and have a really high opinion of yourself.

Feat.Name: Confident
Feat.Description: You are vain and have a really high opinion of yourself.

Feat.Name: Cowardly
Feat.Description: Brave Sir Robin ran away....

Feat.Name: Cultured
Feat.Description: You appreciate the finer things in life, those that are above common usage.

Feat.Name: Dependable
Feat.Description: You are reliable and always there when needed.

Feat.Name: Detached
Feat.Description: You maintain a distance from events that keeps you grounded.

Feat.Name: Discreet
Feat.Description: You maintain a distance from events that keeps you grounded.

Feat.Name: Dishonest
Feat.Description: You are naturally deceitful and insincere with others.

Feat.Name: Distinctive
Feat.Description: You have some distinctive physical feature such as a scar or birthmark.

Feat.Name: Dutiful
Feat.Description: You have a strong sense of duty, which gives you purpose.

Feat.Name: Empathetic
Feat.Description: You can easily understand others feelings. This grants you insight but also means you often bear their burdens.

Feat.Name: Exuberant
Feat.Description: You possess a joy for life and flair that others find attractive.

Feat.Name: Farsighted
Feat.Description: You have difficulty focusing on nearby objects, but your distance vision is good.

Feat.Name: Fair
Feat.Description: You possess a strong sense of fairness that affects your actions.

Feat.Name: Fat
Feat.Description: You are overweight for your race.

Feat.Name: Fearless
Feat.Description: You are known for your bravery.

Feat.Name: Finicky
Feat.Description: You are very fussy and concentrate on the fine details.

Feat.Name: Focused
Feat.Description: You can keep your attention on a task despite many distractions.

Feat.Name: Good Natured
Feat.Description: You are known for your good nature, and your non-violent ways.

Feat.Name: Greedy
Feat.Description: You are greedy and are always looking for ways to materially gain from any situation.

Feat.Name: Hard of Hearing
Feat.Description: You have a slight hearing impairment, and to compensate, you have better vision and reflexes.

Feat.Name: Hardy
Feat.Description: You are made of tougher stuff than the average person.

Feat.Name: Helpful
Feat.Description: You are always looking for ways to help those in need.

Feat.Name: Helpful
Feat.Description: You are always looking for ways to help those in need.

Feat.Name: Honest
Feat.Description: You are naturally straightforward and sincere. This quality helps you befriend new people.

Feat.Name: Humble
Feat.Description: You are self-effacing. You don't seek to see yourself lifted up all the time.

Feat.Name: Illiterate
Feat.Description: You cannot read, but you have devoted yourself to learning through other methods.

Feat.Name: Imaginative
Feat.Description: You have a very wild imagination. You can see things that others cannot but it makes you more susceptible to negative effects.

Feat.Name: Impartial
Feat.Description: You are known for judging siutations and people fairly.

Feat.Name: Inatenttive
Feat.Description: You are skilled at finishing simple tasks quickly, but you often overlook things.

Feat.Name: Independent
Feat.Description: You are a loner, and are used to getting things done on your own.

Feat.Name: Indulgent
Feat.Description: You indulge every passion and appetite you have.

Feat.Name: Inhibited
Feat.Description: You are unable to act in a relaxed and natural way because of self-consciousness or mental restraint.

Feat.Name: Impulsive
Feat.Description: You often act without thinking things through.

Feat.Name: Intelligent
Feat.Description: You are a rare, exceptionally intelligent person.

Feat.Name: Irascible
Feat.Description: You easily get angry.

Feat.Name: Irrational
Feat.Description: You form beliefs based not on rational reasons, but on your feelings and personal experiences.

Feat.Name: Irresponsible
Feat.Description: You are reckless and careless, you do not take responsibility for your actions.

Feat.Name: Irritable
Feat.Description: You are easily irritated. Even the smallest little things can get on your nerves.

Feat.Name: Kamikaze
Feat.Description: You fling yourself into dangerous situations with no thought of your own safety.

Feat.Name: Lazy
Feat.Description: You are very lazy. It takes a lot to motivate you to do anything.

Feat.Name: Malicious
Feat.Description: You often go out of your way to harm others.

Feat.Name: Melancholic
Feat.Description: You often think gloomy thoughts, and are depressed for long periods of time.

Feat.Name: Meticulous
Feat.Description: You are a details person and often like to check and double check everything.

Feat.Name: Musclebound
Feat.Description: You are good at almost everything that requires strength, but the extra muscle mass you carry slows you down.

Feat.Name: Musclebound
Feat.Description: You have difficulty focusing on distant objects, but your up close vision is good.

Feat.Name: Obedient
Feat.Description: You are quick to obey the suggestions and orders others give you.

Feat.Name: Obese
Feat.Description: You are very overweight for your race.

Feat.Name: Obnoxious
Feat.Description: You have an extremely unpleasant personality, it is almost toxic to be around you.

Feat.Name: Observant
Feat.Description: You are quick to notice things, especially the types of things that others would miss.

Feat.Name: Opinionated
Feat.Description: You are conceited and dogmatic in your opinions and quick to voice them to others.

Feat.Name: Opportunistic
Feat.Description: You are an expert at exploiting chances offered by immediate circumstances without reference to a general plan or moral principle.

Feat.Name: Optimistic
Feat.Description: You always look on the bright side of life.

Feat.Name: Outgoing
Feat.Description: You are friendly and talkative.

Feat.Name: Paranoid
Feat.Description: You are jittery and jumpy, giving you better reflex but making you seem delusional.

Feat.Name: Passionate
Feat.Description: You are passionate, and that enthusiasm is noticed by others.

Feat.Name: Persistent
Feat.Description: You don't like to give up, even under duress.

Feat.Name: Persistent
Feat.Description: You don't like to give up, even under duress.

Feat.Name: Perverse
Feat.Description: You have unethical moral tastes.

Feat.Name: Picky
Feat.Description: You are very choosy.

Feat.Name: Precise
Feat.Description: You have great attention to detail.

Feat.Name: Precise
Feat.Description: You have a strength of will and courage in the face of adversity.

Feat.Name: Polite
Feat.Description: You are courteous and well mannered.

Feat.Name: Pompous
Feat.Description: You show an irritating sense of your own self-importance.

Feat.Name: Psychopathic
Feat.Description: You have a mental disorder than leads to violent or bizarre social behaviour. Psychopathy is one of the dark-triad of personality traits.

Feat.Name: Quarrelsome
Feat.Description: You thrive on getting into arguments with others.

Feat.Name: Quick
Feat.Description: You are fast, but less sturdy than average members of your race.

Feat.Name: Reckless
Feat.Description: You naturally sacrifice defence in combat to go on the attack.

Feat.Name: Relentless
Feat.Description: You don't know the meaning of the word "tired." You never give up once you have set your mind to something.

Feat.Name: Reliable
Feat.Description: You are always there when needed.

Feat.Name: Repressed
Feat.Description: You are phsychologically repressed in some way, dealing with conflicted emotions.

Feat.Name: Rude
Feat.Description: You are impolite for others, not showing or caring about their concerns of feelings.

Feat.Name: Sadistic
Feat.Description: You enjoy inflicting pain on others

Feat.Name: Sarcastic
Feat.Description: You enjoy using irony to mock or display contempt to people or ideas.

Feat.Name: Self-centered
Feat.Description: You are narcissistic, you think only of yourself. Narcissicism is one of the dark-triad of personality traits.

Feat.Name: Skinny
Feat.Description: You are very slender for your race.

Feat.Name: Slippery
Feat.Description: You are less adept at grappling and wrestling than others of your race, but you make up for it in agility.

Feat.Name: Slippery
Feat.Description: You are less adept at grappling and wrestling than others of your race, but you make up for it in agility.

Feat.Name: Slow
Feat.Description: You are slow, but sturdier than average members of your race.

Feat.Name: Slovenly
Feat.Description: You have a messy or dirty appearance.

Feat.Name: Sneaky
Feat.Description: You have furtive and sly, always looking for unfair advantages. You are secretive and dishonest, often going behind others backs.

Feat.Name: Sociopathic
Feat.Description: You are sociopathic, a personality disorder characterized by anti-social behaviour and a lack of empathy for others. Sociopathy is one of the dark-triad of personality traits.

Feat.Name: Spellgifted
Feat.Description: You have a gift for working magic. Your spells are more difficult to resist.

Feat.Name: Stingy
Feat.Description: You are a gifted bargainer, but you often cross the line in negotiations.

Feat.Name: Stout
Feat.Description: You are tough for your race.

Feat.Name: Suave
Feat.Description: You are charming, particularly with members of the opposite sex.

Feat.Name: Suave
Feat.Description: You are tough for your race.

Feat.Name: Sullen
Feat.Description: Your personality is sulky and moody and you are often bad-tempered.

Feat.Name: Surly
Feat.Description: You are bad-tempered and unfriendly.

Feat.Name: Suspicious
Feat.Description: You are naturally suspicious of everyone and everything. While this often leads to you being protected from others, it makes you unpleasant to be around.

Feat.Name: Thoughtless
Feat.Description: You can be callous and insensitive to others.

Feat.Name: Torpid
Feat.Description: You are lethargic and apathetic.

Feat.Name: Trusting
Feat.Description: You easily trust others, sometimes to your detriment.

Feat.Name: Uncivilized
Feat.Description: You come from a barbarian tribe, the rules of civilization are foreign to you.

Feat.Name: Unfriendly
Feat.Description: You are just plain hard to be around.

Feat.Name: Unruly
Feat.Description: You are hard to restrain.

Feat.Name: Valiant
Feat.Description: You are courageous and put the safety of others in front of your own.

Feat.Name: Vulgar
Feat.Description: You are just plain hard to be around.

Feat.Name: Truly Skillful
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a character to increase their skills to 150. Normally the limit is 100.

Feat.Name: Truly Amazing
Feat.Description: Having this feat allows a character to increase their attributes to 75. Normally the limit is 30.
